name: osu!
subtitle: rhythm is just a *click* away!
description:
An AltStore and derivatives source for the rhythm game osu!.

Source made by apix and hosted at https://apikusu.github.io/altstore.

Updated daily every 6 hours from 00:30 UTC.

Banner/header:
- Artist: xootynator (https://osu.ppy.sh/users/3717598)
- URL: https://assets.ppy.sh/user-contest-entries/16213/6dc9fdbd0ab4cb1a3c907ce6adad288f75e417b9e40257004c1a8c35a7d73738_opt.jpg

apps.name: osu!
apps.subtitle: A free-to-win rhythm game. Rhythm is just a *click* away!
apps.localizedDescription:
This is the future – and final – iteration of the osu! game client which marks the beginning of an open era!

Currently known by and released under the release codename "lazer". As in sharper than cutting-edge.

news.title: New Featured Artist: SPIRIT GARDEN *
news.caption: You learned about artcore from rhythm games, and our latest Featured Artist is here to offer more.

news.title: Monthly Beatmapping Contest: August 2025
news.caption: Circles and sliders have infinite potential. It's your task to convert that potential into a map that's actually good (and earn some fancy prizes along the way).

news.title: New Featured Artist: DraGonis
news.caption: Whether you're at home or at a certain osu! event, you'll appreciate the sound of DraGonis, our newest Featured Artist!

news.title: Locus 2025: Voting Open
news.caption: 42 teams have created beatmaps with original songs and visuals, and now is your turn to decide which did it the best!

news.title: Summer Mapping Contest #2: Results
news.caption: The second year of our Summer Mapping Contest has come to an end!

news.title: osu!catch World Cup 2025 Concludes
news.caption: The osu!catch World Cup 2025 is officially over, concluding with the coronation of our brand-new champions.

news.title: New Featured Artist: Aspect
news.caption: Aspect's music isn't what you'd expect to hear from a rhythm game, but sometimes that's what osu! needs.

news.title: Monthly Beatmapping Contest: July 2025
news.caption: You have excellent taste in beatmaps. Let's see if the rest of the world agrees.
